messages.title: 3 POSITIVE REASONS TO VOTE FOR TOM BIGGINS
messages.content: Protecting and improving services at the PRH, Fighting for a fair deal for pensioners, Taking crime and immigration seriously

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protecting and improving services at the PRH
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tom Biggins is committed to improving the PRH and will fight any proposals to downgrade or do away with any services in the vitally important hospital.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting for a fair deal for pensioners
keyPolicies.policyDescription: He advocates for protecting the real value pensions, restoring the earnings link for pensions, retaining free bus passes, TV Licences and the winter fuel allowance.
Tom Biggins will work with the police and community groups to ensure that he tackles the problems at source. He presses for a strict, no-nonsense approach to crime.

issues.economy: Conservatives have a plan to get the economy moving and get Britain working again; scrapping the jobs tax.
issues.education: Raising standards in schools as a priority; focus on reading and maths, restore discipline, and demand more from the education system.
issues.governance: A call for a change in politics to tackle waste and the deficit.
issues.health: He is proud of fighting to protect services at the Princess Royal Hospital and will continue to do so.
issues.immigration: Tom is taking immigration seriously and works to deal with the issue at the source and promote a no-nonsense approach.

leaflet.personalStatement: Tom Biggins is proud to be a Shropshire born-and-bred working man who has gained the support and respect of Telford residents by rolling up his sleeves and getting stuck in.

politicalExperience.achievements: Proud of his record of action in Telford and has fought vigorously to protect families, pensioners and businesses.

contactInformation.address: Broadway House, 2 Haygate Road, Wellington, Telford, Shropshire, TF1 1SG

images.caption: Protecting services at the Princess Royal Hospital
Improving our local sporting facilities, particularly for recreation on Sunday

leaflet.additionalNotes: Tom Biggins advocates for protection of local services, fair deal for pensioners, and tackling crime and immigration. He emphasizes his local roots and active involvement in community concerns.
